definition: grass radical 草字頭兒|草字头儿[cao3 zi4 tou2 r5]
to sprout (lit. or fig.)/to bud/to germinate/germ/seed/bud
coleoptile, protective sheath covering an emerging shoot (botany)
terminal bud (growing at the tip of a plant)
axillary bud/bud growing from axil of plant

sentences.english: The branch or bud that is grafted is called the scion.
sentences.chinese: 嫁接上去的枝或芽被稱爲接穗。

sentences.english: It requires a scion with several buds on it .
sentences.chinese: 它要求接穗上有幾個芽。

sentences.english: Summer heat, has been out of bud and leaf stems.
sentences.chinese: 夏日炎炎，芽已抽出莖和葉。

sentences.english: They made me so sad because I couldn't get them come out from dirt.
sentences.chinese: 它們讓我太傷心了，因爲我不能讓它們發好芽。

sentences.english: The 14C-photosynthates would be transported to the bud during the entire growing season.
sentences.chinese: 在整個生長季節中，光合產物都向芽中輸送。

sentences.english: Vestibular tree I planted red and blue, to see the second spring buds.
sentences.chinese: 前庭手種紅蘭樹，看到春風第二芽。

sentences.english: The new grape variety '90-1' was selected from the bud mutation of 'Zhana'.
sentences.chinese: 是從‘乍娜’的芽變中選出的葡萄新品種。

sentences.english: Adventitious buds regeneration from etiolated internode segment of apple cultivar Nagafu No.
sentences.chinese: 富士蘋果黃化莖段再生不定芽的研究。

sentences.english: Epicotyl segments were the optimal explants for adventitious buds regeneration.
sentences.chinese: 上胚軸是再生不定芽的最佳外植體類型。

sentences.english: Differentiation medium for adventitious shoots of different genotypes were decided.
sentences.chinese: 確定了各基因型的不定芽分化培養基。

sentences.english: Ginkgo long branches and buds of the germination of the sticks are high.
sentences.chinese: 銀杏長枝葉芽的萌發力和發枝力都很高。

sentences.english: Apical dominance. The phenomenon in which the presence of a growing apical bud on a plant inhibits the growth of lateral buds.
sentences.chinese: 在植物中頂端芽的生長可以抑制側芽生長的現象。

sentences.english: A small protuberance on a stem or branch, sometimes enclosed in protective scales and containing an undeveloped shoot, leaf, or flower.
sentences.chinese: 芽，萌芽莖或枝上小的隆起物，有時被包在保護性的。

sentences.english: A bud is the part of a plant that becomes a flower, leaf or stem.
sentences.chinese: 芽是植物的一部分，它能變成花，葉或莖。

sentences.english: Branches or buds are cut from one plant and placed on a related kind of plant.
sentences.chinese: 將一種植物的枝或芽砍下，接種在近種植物上。

definition: terminal bud (growing at the tip of a plant)
axillary bud/bud growing from axil of plant
